Professional Objective - My interest lies in the field of Artificial Intelligence, Computer Vision, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, and Robotics. My work focuses on using Artifical Intelligence on Robotics to improve Human-Robot Interaction.

Thesis titled "Moving object detection under an non-stationary camera using a improved background model with foreground clues". Focused on Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Pattern Recognition.

Work Experience

AIBrain Asia & Crosscert

Product Manager/Software Engineer • Present — 2016

Summary Managed and developed on robotics products that include computer vision, machine learning, and conversational AI. Mainly focused on creating a open-sourced humanoid platform.


Gretchen Robot Head

[Developer] Created an open-source robot head research platform. Developed both hardware and software. For the hardware, 2D or 3D camera was used with Robotis motors. For the software ROS was used to control the motors and estimate positions of objects in robot coordinates system. The software also includes remote control of the robot head.


Gretchen Humanoid AI Online Course

[Instructor] Based on the Gretchen robot head with a 2D camera, we created a online course that helps people get interested in robotics and programming a robotic head. After the course, students should be able to program a functional robot head. Users are exposed to various level of programming such as commanding actuators or applying computer vision algorithms. We also developed a social gaze framework as an exemplar and to enhance AIBrain's conversational AI called AICoRE


Gretchen Leg

[Developer] An open-source robot leg research platform to experiment walking and balancing algorithms. Initially we worked with Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin. Hardware and software is still work in progress. Development is slow because it required many trial and errors.


Pohang University of Science and Technology

Researcher • 2016 — 2014

Worked on government projects involved with computer vision, machine learning and surveillance.


Moving object detection in a non-stationary camera

[Researcher] Developed a moving object detection on a non-stationary camera using grid-based background subtraction. Algorithm involves motion compensation of the background model and subtracting the motion compensated background model with the current image to detect the foreground. Suggested a clue-based background model regulation to decrease the noise detected as foreground. Involved in creating a new dataset for foreground detection on a non-stationary camera. Achieved state-of-the-art in 2016.


Vehicle detection and movement classification (moving/stationary)

[Researcher] Developed a moving object detection on a non-stationary camera using grid-based background subtraction. Algorithm involves motion compensation of the background model and subtracting the motion compensated background model with the current image to detect the foreground. Suggested a clue-based background model regulation to decrease the noise detected as foreground. Involved in creating a new dataset for foreground detection on a non-stationary camera. Achieved state-of-the-art in 2016.


Traffic light detection

[Researcher] Used Piotr Dollar's Adaboost toolbox for pedestrian detection to detect traffic lights in Korea. The toolbox was also used to created a dataset for training.


Traffic accident prediction

[Researcher] Implemented traffic accident prediction by analyzing optical flow in MATLAB. The original methodology can be found here.


Georgia Institute of Technology

Research Assistant • 2012 — 2011

Focused on helping children’s diet from low income family through technology at Everyday Computing Lab under Andrea Grimes Parker. Created a webpage prototype to encourage critical thinking about food advertisement.


Teaching Experience

Seoul National University - International Summer Program (SNU ISP)

First Steps in Programming a Humanoid AI Robot

Teaching Assistant (TA) • 2022/2023/2024

This hands-on course offers a comprehensive exploration of robotics, computer vision, machine learning, and AI, all presented in a practical and accessible manner. No particular prior knowledge on robotics or programming is required, however, basic Python skills are recommended.

Dalian American International School - Extracurricular

Introduction to Robotics

Instructor • 2019 Summer/2019 Winter

We used Quattro a mini-walking robot to teach the basics in robotics and reinforcement learning.

Papers and Patents

AIBRP0008 Context Aware Interactive Robot (US Patent 16227474)

Run Cui, WonTaek Chung, HyeJun Yu • 2018

We propose a indoor navigation robot that traverses the environment to complete inventory checks and aid humans in finding products.

A Two-Stage Foreground Propagation for Moving Object Detection in a Non-Stationary Camera (AVSS)

WonTaek Chung, YongHyun Kim, Yong-Joong Kim, DaiJin Kim • 2016

In this paper, we propose a two-stage foreground propagation that uses clues to adapt to the environment and detect moving objects in a non-stationary camera.

I am What I Eat. Identity & Critical Thinking in an Online Health Forum For Kids. (CHI)

Andrea Grimes Parker, Ian McClendon, Catherine Grevet, Victoria Ayo, WonTaek Chung, Veda Johnson, Elizabeth D. Mynatt • 2013

To explore how technology might help kids develop critical thinking, we created an online forum called TalkBack that encourages children to critically analyze the messaging in food ads.
